original: Bengtson, Bengt Daniel, major, Gö-teiborg-Rottnesund, f. 17/2/84 i Slhlm av byggm. N. J. B. o. h. h. f. Jonsön. G. 10 m. Winnie Sundiström. — Stud:-ex. 03, off :ex. à ikustart :l;inj. v. KSS 06, KSHS 11. Major 35, lintr. i kust-art. res. 37. RSO, RVO, OffLettTSO, GMb.g.
translated: Bengt Daniel Bengtson was a major from Göteborg-Rottnesund. He was born on February 17th, 1884 in Stockholm, the son of a builder named N. J. B. He was married to Winnie Sundiström in 1910. Bengtson passed his studentexamen (secondary school leaving exam) in 1903, was commissioned in the military in 1906 and started training in coastal artillery at Kungliga Sjökrigsskolan (the Royal Naval Academy) in 1911. He was promoted to major in 1935 and was in the reserve from 1937. Bengtson was the recipient of several awards, including the Royal Order of the Sword, the Royal Victorian Order, the Officer's Distinguished Service Order, and the Grand Master of the Order of the Sword.

award.name: Grand Master of the Order of the Sword

promotion.name: Started training in coastal artillery at Kungliga Sjökrigsskolan
